domain

Class Estate

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.Square
      • domain.Property
        • domain.Estate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    domain.Buildable

    public class Estate
extends domain.Property
implements domain.Buildable
    Author:
    Elif The Estate class holds the necessary information of an estate on the board, which are buyable, buildable and auctionable objects. The rent, house number and prices are hold by the object instances. The square actions that are executed when a player lands on an estate is also called by this class.

              int rent,
              int price,
              int housePrice,
              java.lang.String color)
        Creates an Estate object with a name, id, rent, price, housePrice, color
        Parameters:
        name - name of the estate as a string
        id - id of the estate as an integer
        rent - rent of the estate as an integer
        price - price of the estate as an integer
        housePrice - price of the house as an integer
        color - color of the estate as a string

        monopoly - monopoly condition as an integer

    • Method Detail

      • squareAction

        public void squareAction(Player currentPlayer,
                         Board board)
        Specified by:
        squareAction in class domain.Property
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer, - players, board
        Requires:
        currentPlayer not to be null, board to be initialized before
        Modifies:
        this, currentPlayer, board
        Effects:
        when the current player lands on the estate it changes the owner of the estate if the owner of the property is null and user wants to buy the estate and updates the monopoly and majority conditions or prompts the current player to pay rent to the owner of the estate.
